intro: Calibrachoa pygmea, commonly known as the dwarf firecracker, is a compact flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes and potatoes, and is known for its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of only a few inches, making it ideal for container gardening and hanging baskets. Its foliage is dark green and slightly hairy, while its flowers bloom profusely throughout the growing season. Calibrachoa pygmea is prized for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in full sun to partial shade.
